title.narrative: INCLUSIVE AND EVIDENCE-BASED POLICY MAKING & PROGRAMMING FOR EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 2.1: Government and partners have increased capacity to strengthen inclusive and evidence-based policymaking and programming for education., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Evaluation, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 201: By 2023, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, increasingly benefit from quality, inclusive and gender- responsive education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1: Government and partners have increased capacity to strengthen inclusive and evidence-based policymaking andprogramming for education.

description.narrative: Government and partners’ capacity has been further enhanced for evidence-based policy making and programming for quality inclusive education through the operationalization of Bhutan Professional Standards for Teachers. Institution of the Education Management Information System (Version 3) will ensure the generation of more disaggregated data on disability, strengthening research by academia on the preparedness of higher education institutions to enroll persons with disabilities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
